III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Personal possessions; money; clothing; storage space
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4125
Section (1) A licensee shall have a written policy that designates all of
Description the following:
(c) The method for ensuring that each resident has
sufficient clean, properly fitting, seasonal clothing.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A and Youth B do not have properly fitting clothes or
enough clothing.
Investigation Interviews:
All interviews were completed at the facility unless otherwise
stated.
Complainant 1 was interviewed via telephone on 1/14/25.
Complainant 1 did not provide any new information to the
allegations.
Administrator 1 was interviewed on 1/22/25. Administrator 1
reported Staff 1 oversees inventory for youth in the program. Staff
1 will document if youth need clothing and fulfil that need. She
completes this responsibility weekly.
Youth A was interviewed on 1/22/25. I observed Youth A and her
clothes fit well. Youth A reported she needed two sweaters, one
pair of shorts, and one pair of sweatpants. Youth A reported she
completed an inventory sheet a week ago expressing this need.
Youth A reported her clothing is too big. Youth A reported the staff
gave her size XL and this was too big for her. Youth A reported
she wanted a different size.
Youth B was interviewed on 2/10/25. Youth B reported a week
ago she did not have enough clothes but was provided clothing a
couple days ago. Youth B reported she was missing two sweaters,
two shorts, and one t-shirt. Youth B reported she completed an
inventory sheet, and the agency did not provide her with the
clothes that she requested right away. Youth B reported that every
Sunday the group completes inventory and lays their clothing on
the bed. Staff go around and check to see if they need anything.
Youth B reported on Monday’s Staff 1 comes around and gives
2

clothing. Youth A did not express that anyone refused to give her
clothes, just that it took too long.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 1/22/25. Staff 1 reported she oversees
intakes and inventory for all youth. Staff 1 reported each youth
receives a specific amount of each clothing item. This is outlined
on the inventory sheet. Staff 1 reported the youth complete their
inventory sheets and each Monday she comes to the unit and
looks at their forms and clothing to ensure what they are
requesting is needed. Staff 1 reported Youth A requested one pair
of shorts and one sweatshirt on 1/13/25. These items were
brought to her, but she refused them due Youth A wanting a size
too small.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 1/27/25.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 comes weekly to the units to check
inventory of all youth. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 sits with each
youth and goes over the form and looks at their clothing.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 will give clothing when it is needed.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was given clothing items but did
not want them because she wanted a smaller size. Supervisor 1
reported the size she wanted was too small. Supervisor 1 reported
Youth B has never reported to her that she didn’t have enough
clothing.
Documents:
• Staff 1 and I reviewed the inventory sheets for Youth A for
the month of December 2024 and January 2025. We
looked at inventory for 12/19/24. Youth A had requested
clothing items. There are no documents stating she
received those until 1/13/25. Youth B did not have an
inventory sheet.
• I reviewed the inventory sheet. Youth are to receive four
each of sweatshirts and sweatpants; five each of shorts;
and six each of t-shirts.
• I reviewed the Intakes and Personnel Items policy. The
agency is to provide items at intake and the “warehouse”
will fill immediately if youth are missing items.
Tour Observation:
• On 1/22/25, I observed the warehouse that stores the
clothing items. The agency has an abundance of clothing
items.
• I went into the unit on 2/10/25 and looked at all the youth’s
clothing to ensure all youth had the allotted clothing. All
3

youth had at least the minimal clothing allotment, if not
more.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Youth A and Youth B both
had enough clothing and the clothing fit. Youth A had refused
clothing due to wanting to wear a smaller size. The agency
determined the smaller size would not fit her and offered her the
appropriate size. Youth B’s request for clothing was given to her
within a week.
Technical Assistance:
Staff 1 was not documenting on the inventory sheets when she
determined the request from the youth did not warrant more
clothes. Leaving this blank on the inventory sheets, made it
appear that the youth were not given items they needed. Youth
A’s inventory appeared as if she had not been given clothes for
almost a month. Technical assistance was provided that the
agency note why items were not given and note when items were
given. If the agency notes the youth did not receive items
requested, the reason the request was denied is to be noted.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
Description service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was not seen by a nurse when she smashed her finger.
On 1/14/25 she asked to be seen by the nurse for her finger and
the facility refused.
Investigation Interviews:
All interviews were completed at the facility unless otherwise
stated.
Administrator 1 was interviewed on 1/22/25. Administrator 1
reported that all youth who need medical can fill out a form and
place in the medical drop box. The nurse will then read the form
and see the youth to assess.
Youth A was interviewed on 1/22/25. Youth A reported she asked
staff to put a “note” into the nurse so that she can have her finger
assessed. Youth A reported she hurt her finger at a different
4

facility and now it looked like her nail was coming out. Youth A
reported the staff refused to create the note for her. Youth A did
not mention specific staff. Youth A reported she does have access
to medical request documents. Youth A reported those documents
can be filled out and dropped into the medical box. Youth A
reported she did not complete one. Youth A reported she felt this
was a medical emergency, so she told the supervisor instead of
filling out a paper. Youth A reported she did end up seeing the
nurse and then was taken to urgent care. Urgent care couldn’t do
anything, so they left.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 1/27/25.
Supervisor 1 reported she is unaware of anyone refusing any
youth medical care. Supervisor 1 reported a youth has access to
medical requests documents. They are to fill them out and place
them into the medical box. Supervisor 1 reported the nurse will
come and see the youth after she reads the form.
Nurse 1 was interviewed on 2/10/25. Nurse 1 reported as soon as
she was made aware that Youth A requested medical attention
she saw her. Nurse 1 reported she had slammed her finger in a
door at her previous placement. Youth A’s nail was lifting off of the
nail bed. Nurse 1 reported she sent her to urgent care and urgent
care refused to see her. Nurse 1 reported urgent care did not
provide a reason why but provided her with a document stating
they didn’t see her. Nurse 1 reported she contacted the manager
at the urgent care and Youth A went back to urgent care and was
seen.
Documents:
• I reviewed the case note completed by Nurse 1 dated
1/14/25. Nurse 1 assessed Youth A and requested her be
sent out to urgent care. Youth A had requested medical on
1/13/25.
• I reviewed the document from the Covenant MedExpress in
Frankenmuth. The letter reported Youth A was “brought in
but not seen.”
• I reviewed the After Visit summary dated 1/16/25 for Youth
A. On 1/16/25 she was seen at the Covenant MedExpress
at Frankenmuth. Manage pain and swelling was
recommended.
• I reviewed the Health and Dental policy. The policy does
not outline how youth are to be seen by the medical team,
but does state the “staff and clients of the program are
oriented to the methods of accessing health, medical,
dental, and clinical services…”
5

Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. The procedure verbalized
by Youth A, Supervisor 1, and Administrator 1 was not followed by
Youth A. All reported a medical request is to be completed and
placed in the medical box. Nurse 1 notes reported she requested
to see her on 1/13/25 but did not complete a medical request.
Youth A was seen after she filed a complaint with the Division of
Child Welfare Licensing. This complaint was filed on 1/14/25 at
8:03am. She was seen at 1:10pm on 1/14/25. Youth A did not fill
out a medical request though. Policy states that all youth are
oriented to the method of receiving health services and through
interviews it was determined Youth A did know this procedure, but
did not follow this procedure.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was provided for the Health and Dental
policy to be updated as it currently states all youth are oriented to
the procedure for receiving health care but does not outline what
that procedure is. The agency needs to outline the procedure of
receiving health care.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation addressed allegations of inadequate clothing and denied medical care at a youth facility. Investigators found the facility had sufficient clothing and proper procedures for both clothing requests and medical access, though documentation and policy clarity needed improvement. Youth A's clothing issue stemmed from a preference for a smaller size than recommended, and her medical care was delayed because she did not follow the correct request procedure, not due to staff refusal. Overall, no policy violations were substantiated, and culpability for the alleged failures was not found on the part of the facility.
